content: I was assigned to this PR, and while I think the code is fine there are some lingering questions regarding whether we (1) want this linter, (2) whether we want it to be implemented in lean instead of python (and if so should we (3) merge this anyway or wait until it is rewritten first), and (4) whether we want it to suggest simp only or simp? says simp only, and I would rather not make unilateral decisions on these four points. Any comments?
I vote for "merge now" and rewrite/improve later. I don't think this version has real downsides. And it might take months before someone writes a version in lean.

I had to fix a merge conflict and now this is not building. I don't understand the error: It says
/home/lean/actions-runner/_work/_temp/bed61f50-6bb0-470b-8e8b-a1402f68d053.sh: line 1: scripts/lean-pr-testing-comments.sh: No such file or directory
But I never touched this file
Ok I fixed it, do I need to do anything to reactivate bors?
You don't, but a maintainer will need to
I'd be curious why it's needed, certainly
For instance, as has been commented also elsewhere, a rfl after simp is often an indication of a missing simp lemma what would close the goal.
While it's a bit smelly, it is typically accepted.
